subsc: Health,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the project were only
            partially achieved, with the Bank's performance not
            fully satisfactory, mostly in regards to project design and
            quality at entry. Conversely, the Government's
            performance was satisfactory, considering the circumstances
            during implementation. Similarly, considerations extend to
            the GEF-financed biodiversity activities, where with no
            prior experience, the Borrower showed its commitment by
            proposing to restructure the project. Among the key lessons
            learned, it is paramount to note the overly optimistic
            project design which failed to assess the capacities of the
            implementing agencies. Therefore, technical assistance
            projects are important instruments to provide for basic
            environmental management, thus tangible and quantifiable
            objectives, and monitoring indicators would be in place. The
            likelihood of political, fiscal and economic changes require
            flexibility in project design, so as to adapt to change.
            While for the development of environmental institutions a
            greater role should be given to state/municipal governments
            and the private sector, the decentralization activities
            should be accompanied by appropriate fiscal decentralization
            mechanisms. Securing the trust of the community need to
            accompany any protected area program for a long term sustainability.
